ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Longview Fibre Paper and Packaging, Inc. Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_title: Longview Fibre Paper and Packaging, Inc. Market-Based Rate T
record_data.record_narrative_name: Longview Fibre Paper and Packaging, Inc. Market-Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text: LONGVIEW FIBRE PAPER AND PACKAGING, INC. MARKET-BASED RATE TARIFF 1. Availability: Longview Fibre Paper and Packaging, Inc. ("Longview Fibre") makes electric energy and capacity available under this Tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. Longview Fibre also makes available to any purchaser, except as prohibited below, the ancillary services listed below. a) PJM: Longview Fibre offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. b) New York: Longview Fibre offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. c) New England: Longview Fibre offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc. d) California: Longview Fibre offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. 2. Applicability: This Tariff is applicable to all sales of energy and capacity by Longview Fibre at market-based rates. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between Longview Fibre and the purchaser. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between Longview Fibre and the purchaser. 5. Effective Date: This Tariff is effective on and after the date specified by the FERC. 6. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Longview Fibre shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Longview Fibre's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Longview Fibre's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 7. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: The Commission granted Longview Fibre in Docket No. ER07-527-000 (March 6, 2007) the following waivers and authorizations: (1) waiver of 18 C.F.R. Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information (except for 35.12(a), 35.13(b) 35.15 and 35.16); (2) the requirements of 18 C.F.R. Parts 41, 101, and 141 regarding accounting and record keeping requirements (except for 141.14 and 141.15); and (3) blanket authorization under Section 204 of the Federal Power Act and 18 C.F.R. Part 34 for any future securities or debt issuances by Longview Fibre. 8. Seller Category: Longview Fibre is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a).
record_data.filing_title: Longview Fibre Paper and Packaging, Inc. Baseline Market-Based Rate Tariff
